snippet: An arbitrator sided with the New Orleans Saints in ruling that Jimmy Graham can only be considered a tight end for the purposes of his franchise tag designation.
abstract: Arbitrator sides with New Orleans Saints, ruling that Jimmy Graham can only be considered a tight end for the purposes of his franchise tag designation; Graham argued that he was used as a wide receiver often enough to qualify for more lucrative receiver tag.
lead_paragraph: An arbitrator sided with the New Orleans Saints in ruling that Jimmy Graham can only be considered a tight end for the purposes of his franchise tag designation.
